author: wsjcom
title: Cape Town: Happy for Good Advice From All
text:
Seth M. Siegel argues that “Cape Town May Dry Up Because of an Aversion to Israel” (op-ed, Feb. 22). A number of his claims require correction. Cape Town taps are no longer expected to run dry in 2018. Capetonians have risen magnificently to the challenge of the most severe and prolonged drought in a century, reducing their average daily usage by 60% from around 1,200 megalitres before the drought hit, to around 500 megalitres today. If residents are able to maintain that rate over the next six months, the city will not run out of water.
